Metadata: "Taxonomy of economic seaweeds with reference to some Pacific and Caribbean species." Volume II
Results of an International Workshop, Qingdao, China, September 22-25, 1986.

Confusion in the taxonomy of economically important tropical and subtropical algae remains the single greatest obstacle to progress in Pacific seaweed aquaculture and marine natural products chemistry. In this richly illustrated volume, the second in a series, an international group of specialists representing the United States, Japan, China, Chile, and Taiwan describe the results of a workshop on the taxonomy of the groups "Gracilaria, Polycavernosa, Eucheuma, Sargassum, Laurencia," and the Gelidiales. The workshop, co-sponsored by the California Sea Grant College Program and the Academia Sinica of the People's Republic of China, was held in Qingdao in September 1986. The following papers are included in this publication: 1. Japanese and Taiwanese species of "Sargassum" subgenus "Sargassum". Tadao Yoshida pp. 5-21. 2. Studies on Chinese species of Zygocarpic "Sargassum". Tseng C. K. and Lu Baoren pp. 23-54. 3. Clarification of some subgeneric nomenclature in "Sargassum" subgenus "Sargassum". Isabella A. Abbott, Tseng C. K., and Lu Baoren pp. 55-57. 4. "Sargassum" from Micronesia. Roy T. Tsuda pp. 59-63. 5. "Sargassum" (Phaeophyta, Fucales, Sargassaceae) in the Hawaiian Islands. William H. Magruder pp. 65-87. 6. Taxonomic studies on Chinese Gelidiales (Rhodophyta). Bernabe Santelices pp. 91-107. 7. Chinese species of "Gelidium" Lamouroux and other Gelidiales (Rhodophyta), with key, list, and distribution to the common species. Zhang Junfu (C. F. Chang) and Xia Enzhan pp. 109-113. 8. Separation of "Gelidium" and "Pterocladia" on vegetative characters. D. Rodriguez and B. Santelices pp. 115-125. 9. On two new "Gracilaria" (Gigartinales, Rhodophyta) from South China. Zhang Junfu (C. F. Chang) and Xia Bangmei pp. 131-136. 10. Some species of "Gracilaria" and "Polycavernosa" from Thailand. Isabella A. Abbott pp. 137-150. 11. Some species of "Gracilaria" and "Polycavernosa" from the Siboga expedition. Isabella A. Abbott pp. 151-156. 12. "Prodromus ad systematica eucheumatoideor​um": a tribe of commercial seaweeds related to "Eucheuma" (Solieriaceae, Gigartinales). Maxwell S. Doty pp. 159-207. 13. The genus "Eucheuma" J. Agardh in Florida and the Caribbean. Donald P. Cheney pp. 209-219. 14. "Laurencia" from the Hawaiian Islands: key, annotated list, and distribution of the species. Karla J. McDermid pp. 231-247. 15. "Laurencia" from China: key, list and distribution of the species. Zhang Junfu (C. F. Chang) and Xia Bangmei pp. 249-252. 16. Agar from a species of "Laurencia", a red seaweed from the Hawaiian Islands. Earl K. Zablackis and Karla J. McDermid pp. 253-256.
